Job Position: Chief Executive Officer - Insurance Brokerage

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Job


	The KOKO Group is seeking a talented individual to lead the strategic direction, growth, and overall performance of an insurance brokerage subsidiary in Lagos.
	This is a full-time, on-site role strategic leadership role for a professional to work with operational knowledge of brokerage business, business growth and development, governance and compliance with NAICOM regulations etc.
	The ideal candidate will manage the overall operations of the company as well as develop and implement strategies that meet the needs of the customers, the stakeholders, and the employees.
	They will be responsible for making key decisions and executing the culture of the company.


Responsibilities


	Develop and execute the business plan and strategy for growth and profitability
	Build and manage client relationships across markets and sectors
	Lead, hire, and develop the team required for sustainable growth
	Oversee compliance, risk, and operational excellence
	Report directly to the Territory Director


Requirements


	Must have at least 10 years post-graduation work experience (5 of which must be in a similar capacity) within a financial institution environment -Insurance, Insurance Brokerage
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in insurance brokerage, including 2+ years in senior leadership
	The Ideal candidate must demonstrate a track record of performance in the insurance or finance business
	Proven experience in the startup of an insurance brokerage firm
	Registered with the Nigerian Council of Registered Insurance Brokers (NCRIB)
	Must be a member of Insurance Professional body: CIIN, AIIN, ACII, CFA, CIS or CISI


Renumeration
Very competitive.

Centre Manager Job at the NSIA-LUTH Cancer Centre (NLCC)




        
    

        
        NSIA-LUTH Cancer Centre (NLCC) is a specialist cancer treatment facility located in Lagos State, Nigeria. At NLCC, we offer modern innovative therapies and have the largest, most experienced and skilled oncology workforce in Nigeria. Our team of medical experts, including Clinical and Radiation Oncologists, Medical Physicists, Radiotherapists, and Oncology nurses, are trained to offer comprehensive and compassionate care at every stage of the patient’s journey. We provide patients with a multidisciplinary team approach for the management of all types of cancers with state-of-the-art equipment for cancer treatments to post-treatment consultation and supportive therapies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Centre Manager

Job Locations: Akwa Ibom, Bauchi, Delta, Enugu, Kwara, Oyo, Plateau and Yobe
Job type: Full-time

Requirements


	BSc. in Business Administration, Healthcare Management or Public Administration
	Relevant experience in the applied role or a related professional/healthcare environment
	Required academic and professional qualification, certifications, and licenses applicable to the role

Technical Operator Support Job at Mactay Consulting




        
    

        
        Mactay Consulting is one of Nigeria’s foremost Human Resources Management Consulting firms, empowering organisations through transformative people and performance solutions. For over four decades, we have been the trusted partner to Africa’s most prominent organisations, delivering deep expertise and innovative strategies that drive sustainable business success. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Operator Support

Job Location: Mushin, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Technical Operator Support will be responsible for operation of the equipment and optimal production process for filling and packaging of cosmetic products according to safety, quality and production order.


Responsibilities


	Initiate standard operating procedures to run equipment and ensure compliance.
	Relate firsthand information to superior in a precise and timely manner.
	He ensures he works with production plan as communicated by the production team lead.
	Trouble shoot and fix equipment related fault, call for technical intervention when deemed necessary.
	Perform regular cleaning of the equipment when out of base condition.
	In his area of responsibility, he ensures the compliance of the defined quality of the products in line with standards.
	Support on implementation of quality systems in close contact with the quality team.
	Responsible for safety compliance in his area.


Requirements


	ND/HND in Mechanical / Mechatronics / Electrical / Automation Engineering is required.
	1 – 3 years of Experience in Cosmetic industries.
	Knowledge in MS Office.
	Attention to detail with good troubleshooting skills.


Benefits


	Salary: N165,000 per month.
	HMO, 13th month, Pension and Lunch.


Method of Application
